newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends unchanged for second day.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends unchanged for second day.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed unchanged against its U.S. counterpart for second straight day on Tuesday as expected year-end U.S. dollar demand failed to appear.
The local dollar again ended at T$27.493, the same as Monday. Turnover through dealers was only US$54.5 million.
"Today's trade was extremely thin. We traders may have to drive taxis at night to make a living," said one dealer.
Dealers said trading interest had been shrinking as the Taiwan dollar has recently shown no direction.
A narrow T$27.49-27.50 range was seen for Wednesday.
